definition: to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains

sentences.english: Nothing but rabbit tobacco. Pa smokes it in a corn cob .
sentences.chinese: 他把一段玉米棒子挖空，然后装上烟叶。

sentences.english: He had finished gouging out a cob.
sentences.chinese: 他刚挖空一只玉米棒子。

sentences.english: That is a poem full of precious images .
sentences.chinese: 那是尽是挖空心思的意象的诗篇。

sentences.english: He contrived to make a mess of the whole thing。
sentences.chinese: 他挖空心思反而把事情全盘弄糟了。

sentences.english: The king of Jin racked his brains, but could not work out a plan.
sentences.chinese: 晋君挖空心思，也没能想出个好办法。

sentences.english: The ground was excavated for a foundation.
I am sure he is seeking for some jibes .
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定他在想挖空心思苦的话。

sentences.english: Ellie deliberate decision robbery is tasted like the happy life.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉挖空心思的决议强夺品如的幸福生活。

sentences.english: Our new habitation was an excavation made in the earth.
sentences.chinese: 我们的新住所是一处挖空的地洞。

sentences.english: Each squash is then hollowed out and the seeds and pulp are thrown away.
sentences.chinese: 他会将每个南瓜都挖空，然后丢掉里面的种子和瓜瓤。

sentences.english: He hollowed out a log and made it into a boat.
sentences.chinese: 他把原木挖空，制成了小船。

definition: to hollow out/to empty out/to use up/(finance) tunneling
to dig into/to cut a mine into
to flatten/to level/to raze to the ground
to stuff full/to cram in/packed tight/chock full
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
